name: Swede Savage
introduction: Savage was driving in the 1973 Indianapolis 500 when he lost control on a patch of oil, and had a huge accident when the car hit the wall almost head-on. Despite being engulfed in flames for a few seconds, Savage was conscious and joking with medical personnel on the way to the hospital. But 412 weeks later, Savage succumbed to complications of Hepatitis B (from a tainted transfusion) and lung failure (from breathing methanol fumes after the accident).
